snippet: Marking the anniversary of the landmark Brown v. Board of Education decision, civil rights advocates say American schools are increasingly split along racial lines.
abstract: First Lady Michelle Obama tells 1,200 graduating high school seniors in Topeka, Kan, city that gave rise to landmark Brown v Board of Education case, that Brown's advances are being reversed; says many school districts nationwide have pulled back efforts to integrate, and many communities have become less diverse; also points out schools attended by children of color often lag behind.
lead_paragraph: Marking the anniversary of the landmark Brown v. Board of Education decision, civil rights advocates say American schools are increasingly split along racial lines.

headline.main: Michelle Obama Cites View of Growing Segregation
headline.print_headline: Mrs. Obama, in Speech, Cites Growing Divisions
